column4: astronaute-> you can always tail a log file written to ... man tail please
astronaute-> look at your web.xml of your app or tomcats own web.xml ,  see the sample apps where and how they use loggers
astronaute-> i assumed you wrote your own webapp, so you must know how to use loggers, and not stdout
astronaute-> tomcat comes with example webapps, see how it uses the loggers
astronaute-> i dont know what flex data services is, but if its a webapp running on tomcat, it should have the correct hooks to use the loggers, look for its config files how it logs
astronaute-> webapps are not supposed to be logging to stdout, webapps should not be accessing stdout only loggers
astronaute-> i am not sure if you are following me, webapp servers are not normally doing output to stdout,  only spits out output to log files
astronaute-> look here maybe? {Tomcat}/webapps/samples/WEB-INF/flex/logs/flex.log
astronaute-> then do a tail of this log file
astronaute-> it should be the same as in windows,  you have a tool to configure webapp settings via the web..
you are right there is flex.log i will dgg it thank you ! :)
yes i need to debug some flex app, but cant find how to set stdout path :/
stdout.log in fact is supposed to be generated too, well how can I monitor it over terminal please ?
my problem is that I cant find that file
i dont have any but ill try to figure it out
no it is about flex data services, i need to see its logs because there is some problemes on launch
it logs in stdout file normally, but where i dont know "ConsoleTarget"
it is a logger : flex.messaging.log.ConsoleTarget
weird thing, i have stdout.log on windows but not on ubuntu (with flex logging)
same webapp
thats it, but it is simply not normal that on windows i get that log file and not on my ubuntu
there must be some place to configure it, on windows it is simple in its service GUI but ubuntu im lost
